unnormalised: New office alert! Infosys just inaugurated its newest branch in Guwahati, Assam! The address is Plot No. 14, Industrial Area, Amingaon, Guwahati - 781031. Apparently, it's a massive campus, spread across 50 acres! Heard they are planning to hire a lot of freshers from the North-East this year.
normalised: New office alert! I-n-f-o-s-y-s just inaugurated its newest branch in Guwahati, Assam! The address is Plot Number fourteen, Industrial Area, Amingaon, Guwahati - seven eight one zero three one. Apparently, it's a massive campus, spread across fifty acres! Heard they are planning to hire a lot of freshers from the North-East this year.

unnormalised: The official launch event was held on 20/07/2024, graced by some big names in the IT sector. The new office is expected to boost the local economy and create lots of job opportunities for the youth. It's supposedly near the airport, around 25 km from the city center. Easy commute, hopefully!
normalised: The official launch event was held on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four, graced by some big names in the I-T sector. The new office is expected to boost the local economy and create lots of job opportunities for the youth. It's supposedly near the airport, around twenty five kilometer from the city center. Easy commute, hopefully!

unnormalised: Folks are already discussing parking availability, though. One employee, Rakesh Sharma, said "Hope they have ample parking; finding space near DLF Cyber Hub (Gurgaon) was always a nightmare!" Well, let’s hope Infosys has thought of that.
normalised: Folks are already discussing parking availability, though. One employee, Rakesh Sharma, said "Hope they have ample parking; finding space near D-L-F Cyber Hub (Gurgaon) was always a nightmare!" Well, let’s hope I-n-f-o-s-y-s has thought of that.

unnormalised: Anyway, congrats to Infosys and Guwahati! Wishing them all the best. Maybe next time I'm in Assam, I'll swing by and grab a chai at the nearby tea stall, reportedly located at G.S. Road, Dispur, 781006.
